page.title: 01Gazetteer Block 05120216
page.content: The block straddles the{Herts./Beds.} border between{Batford, Harpenden}and {Luton.}The{R. Lea}runs{NW/SE}through its{SW}quadrant.This{valley}is used by the{rly. line, St. Pancras}to the{Mid- {lands;}while a{disused rly. track}can still be traced. A{road A6129}runs parallel to the river while others connect with{Kimpton}and{Peter's} {Green.}The only village,{East Hyde, consists of few houses; while the greater part of this{12sq.km.block}is devoted to{arable farming}with some {stock raising.}Many{fields}have an {irregular shape}because when medieval {forest lands}were cleared,{tree stumps and{pudding stones}were left in place; {primitive tools}being the only ones available. So fields were formed around these{natural obstacles,}thus retaining this{distinctive, irregular {pattern}in{field shape}to this day.
